html: Taxpayers already give up some of their paychecks in taxes to the gov't, but people don’t normally feel like they get much of a say in how it's used. Including conditions when donating money to a school or non-profit is common — this would allow it to happen at the federal level.
text: Taxpayers already give up some of their paychecks in taxes to the gov't, but people don’t normally feel like they get much of a say in how it's used. Including conditions when donating money to a school or non-profit is common — this would allow it to happen at the federal level.

html: Closing an IRS office at any time creates problems for taxpayers in Wyoming. But it is particularly burdensome when it occurs during the filing season – and the first one after our comprehensive tax reform – when folks continue to learn how to comply with new tax changes.
text: Closing an IRS office at any time creates problems for taxpayers in Wyoming. But it is particularly burdensome when it occurs during the filing season – and the first one after our comprehensive tax reform – when folks continue to learn how to comply with new tax changes.

html: A newly divided Congress will pose its own unique challenges in the years ahead, but it is important that we as public servants who wish to do best by our constituents and our country remember the importance of finding agreement without needing to compromise our principles.

html: Congratulations to @SenJohnBarrasso and @RepLizCheney on their re-elections to the Senate and House. I look forward to continuing to work with them. I am also looking forward to working with Wyoming’s next governor Mark Gordon to support the people of Wyoming.

html: America once again saw millions of citizens go to the polls to exercise their right to vote on Election Day. No matter their party affiliation, running for office takes a leap of faith and I applaud those who took a chance and put their name on a ballot.

html: The attempted attacks today aimed at public officials & the media are reprehensible. Violence is not an acceptable way to disagree. I hope the person or people responsible are caught & brought to justice. Thanks to first responders & others who risk their lives to protect others.

html: I am disappointed by a federal judge’s decision to return the Yellowstone grizzly bear to the endangered species list. Wildlife experts and federal officials agree that the grizzly bears in this region have been fully recovered for years.

html: After attending the U.S. Supreme Court today to hear the arguments in South Dakota v. Wayfair, Inc., I called on the court to overturn its earlier decision which barred states from collecting sales and use tax from remote sellers.
text: After attending the U.S. Supreme Court today to hear the arguments in South Dakota v. Wayfair, Inc., I called on the court to overturn its earlier decision which barred states from collecting sales and use tax from remote sellers.

html: This spending and interest on our debt will soon consume all the taxes and revenues the federal government collects. That’s before one dollar goes to national defense or our other priorities. Congress must come to terms with this overspending.

html: It’s $21 trillion now and unfortunately our inclination is still to increase spending. That was the problem then and it is a problem now – not the tax cut. We need to prioritize and get the most out of the dollars we do spend. (3/3)
text: It’s $21 trillion now and unfortunately our inclination is still to increase spending. That was the problem then and it is a problem now – not the tax cut. We need to prioritize and get the most out of the dollars we do spend. (3/3)

html: I’ve heard some critics say the same thing now about our new tax law. That reminds me of another quote from President Reagan. “We don’t have a trillion-dollar debt because we haven’t taxed enough; we have a trillion-dollar debt because we spend too much.” (2/3)
text: I’ve heard some critics say the same thing now about our new tax law. That reminds me of another quote from President Reagan. “We don’t have a trillion-dollar debt because we haven’t taxed enough; we have a trillion-dollar debt because we spend too much.” (2/3)

html: “I know you have been told by some that we should do away with the tax cuts in order to reduce the deficit. That’s like trying to pull a game out in the fourth quarter by punting on third down.” Ronald Reagan said that in 1982. (1/3)pic.twitter.com/EegfTjaH5r

html: It is also important to remember that the president’s budget is a only suggestion; Congress has the final say on spending.
text: It is also important to remember that the president’s budget is a only suggestion; Congress has the final say on spending.

html: We must start now because one thing is clear: ignoring the tough problems today will not make them disappear, and the longer they persist, the more difficult they will be to address. It’s a tough road ahead, but I am hopeful we can find success.http://bit.ly/2ss2xud

html: I earned the rank of Eagle Scout on this day in 1957. Thanks to the National Eagle Scout Association for the reminder. I often think back to my journey to becoming an Eagle. What I learned in Scouting and becoming an Eagle continue to help guide me. What a valuable experience.

html: 61 years ago, I earned the rank of Eagle Scout. This photo is LeRoy Bohnsack of Sheridan and me (on the right) reaching our Eagle Scout status back in 1957. I am just as proud of my Eagle Award today as I was on the day I received it.pic.twitter.com/vwPl8sXMJi

html: The president signed our historic #TaxReform bill today, which will put more money in people’s pockets, grow the economy, create jobs and raise wages.pic.twitter.com/l5G28Svw8j

html: And #TaxReform lowers individual tax rates so people can keep more of their hard-earned money. And this (lengthy) list shows just some of the benefits people will see under the new bill.
text: And #TaxReform lowers individual tax rates so people can keep more of their hard-earned money. And this (lengthy) list shows just some of the benefits people will see under the new bill.

html: #TaxReform continues and expands the deduction for charitable contributions people give to their local church, charity, or community organization.
text: #TaxReform continues and expands the deduction for charitable contributions people give to their local church, charity, or community organization.

html: Under new #TaxReform businesses offering leave for employees to care for sick child, check on elderly parent or take maternity or paternity leave would receive tax credit based on those employees’ wages.
text: Under new #TaxReform businesses offering leave for employees to care for sick child, check on elderly parent or take maternity or paternity leave would receive tax credit based on those employees’ wages.

html: Billions of barrels of oil will be made accessible by opening non-wilderness area of ANWR for responsible energy development thanks to #TaxReform and efforts of @lisamurkowski.
text: Billions of barrels of oil will be made accessible by opening non-wilderness area of ANWR for responsible energy development thanks to #TaxReform and efforts of @lisamurkowski.

html: Tuition waivers for graduate students will remain tax free under new #TaxReform.
text: Tuition waivers for graduate students will remain tax free under new #TaxReform.

html: New #TaxReform keeps current deductions for student loan interest.
text: New #TaxReform keeps current deductions for student loan interest.

html: Homeowners mortgage-interest rate deduction still available under new #TaxReform on mortgages up to $750,000.
text: Homeowners mortgage-interest rate deduction still available under new #TaxReform on mortgages up to $750,000.

html: You can still deduct state property, income and sales taxes up to $10,000 under new #TaxReform.
text: You can still deduct state property, income and sales taxes up to $10,000 under new #TaxReform.

html: Under new #TaxReform taxpayers with kids can claim an up to $2,000 credit for each qualifying child under 17. That’s double what it was.
text: Under new #TaxReform taxpayers with kids can claim an up to $2,000 credit for each qualifying child under 17. That’s double what it was.

html: #TaxReform means no more penalties for folks who decide not to buy Affordable Care Act insurance because they can’t afford it.
text: #TaxReform means no more penalties for folks who decide not to buy Affordable Care Act insurance because they can’t afford it.

html: #TaxReform allows taxpayers to deduct medical expenses that exceed 7.5 percent of their adjusted gross income.
text: #TaxReform allows taxpayers to deduct medical expenses that exceed 7.5 percent of their adjusted gross income.
